cip.render

Interface IDynXmlObject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ACamera, ADualMaterialTexture, ADynamicNamedObject, AGeometry, ALight, AlphaImage, Ambient, Aperture, AQuadricGeo, ATexture, Blinn, Blinn, Block, Checkerboard, Cone, ConstantColour, Cylinder, Ellipsoid, Gaussian, Hall, Hyperboloid, HyperParaboloid, MapLinear, MapNatural, Outlined, Paraboloid, Phong, PinHole, PlanarPolyhedra, Point, PositionTexture, Ridges, Sphere, SpheresTexture, Spot, Torrance, TrowRietz, Wavy, Whitted, XfmGeometry, XfmLight

    public interface IDynXmlObject
    This is the interface to a dynamically loaded object described in an XML node. The general idea here is that the node identifies the classname, the object is instantiated by a factory, and this interface provides the mechanism for the instantiated object to read itself. The object is also responsible for being able to write itself to an XML node.

    In practice, an application using these objects would instantiate and read the object and then query what interfaces the object supports (what capabilities the object possesses).

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    DynXmlObjLoader

    • Method Detail

      • loadFromXml

        void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                 @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                 @Nullable
                 @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
          throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Loads this object from an XML DOM Document element. The DynXmlObjLoader has parsed the element and attributes to determine that this is a dynamically loaded object, found and instantiated the class, and is now sending the node to the object so it can initialize itself based on the contents of the node.
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • toChildXmlElement

        void toChildXmlElement(@NotNull
                       @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element parentEl)
        Add this object as a <DynamicallyLoadedObject> DOM element that is a child of some parent element.
        Parameters:
        parentEl - The parent element.
